profiledesc.creation: Finding aid exported into EAD from InMagic DB/Textworks 13.0. Encoded by Margaret Jessup. January 27, 2014

did.head: Collection Overview
did.abstract:
Musicians; Women's music organization. Includes materials for the first 30 years for women's music organization from Cincinnati, Ohio. Grant applications, organizational periodicals, and administrative papers. Also included are DVDs and audio CDs of performances as well as CDs with photographs of MUSE members.
[NOTE: The contents list for this collection is not online. Contact the Sophia Smith Collection if you would like one sent to you.]

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: MUSE Cincinnati Women's Choir was founded in 1983 by Dr. Catherine Roma, who served as the organization's Artistic Director from the Choir's founding until her retirement in 2013. The Choir is part of the larger women's music movement that emerged between the 1970s and 1990s in an effort to combine work for social change and the powerful love of music. According to the organization's mission statement, MUSE is "dedicated to musical excellence and social change" and works to spread "their message of peace and unity through music" through performances in the United States and the international community.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents of the Collection
scopecontent.p: Includes materials for the first 30 years for women's music organization from Cincinnati, Ohio. Grant applications, organizational periodicals, and administrative papers. Also included are DVDs and audio CDs of performances as well as CDs with photographs of MUSE members.
[NOTE: The contents list for this collection is not online. Contact the Sophia Smith Collection if you would like one sent to you.]

accessrestrict.p:
The papers are open to research according to the regulations of the Sophia Smith Collection with the following caveats:
This collection has not been fully processed and therefore may be difficult to use.
Access to audiovisual materials may first require production of research copies.

userestrict.p: MUSE retains copyright on audio and video recordings in the collection. The SSC owns copyright owner for other unpublished works created by the organization. Permission must be obtained to publish reproductions or quotations beyond "fair use." It is the responsibility of the researcher to identify all copyright holders.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Please use the following format when citing materials from this collection:
MUSE Records, Sophia Smith Collection, Smith College, Northampton, Mass.

accruals.p: Periodic additions to collection are expected and may not be reflected in this record.

acqinfo.p: The MUSE records were donated to the Sophia Smith Collection by Catherine Roma beginning in 2013.

processinfo.p: Accessioned by Kathleen Nutter and Abbie Pratt, 2013
